concept.title: Community Group Detail
concept.abstract: The Community Group record details the various capabilities of staff users in exercising control throughout the Community Portal.

conbody.section:
There are several fields that staff users need to configure on the Community Group record:
Community Group Name-Displays as the Group Name in search results and on the Community Group Detail page.
Member Entity Type-Defines the type of group members allowed in a group: Contacts, Accounts, or Groups. A group cannot contain more than one Member Entity Type.
Type-Categorizes groups in the system through a picklist. The System Administrator can update the picklist values.
Is Published-Publishes a Community Group in the Community Portal.
Site-Links each group to a site, creating visibility in the Community Portal. Without a site, the group will only exist as data in the backend and will not be published in the Community Portal.
Group Owner-If enabled by the System Administrator, updates the group information when logged into the Community Portal. Required for Community Groups that will be published in the Community Portal. Group Owner is also referred to as the Administrator of the group.
Members-Counts the number of members in a group via roll-up summary.

section.p: The fields for the group's description and images establish the page aesthetics and main text:

ul.li: Banner-Hosts the link of the image displayed on the Community Group Detail page in the Community Portal. The Group Owner can change the banner image from within the Community Portal by clicking the Change Background button. Any changes to the banner image appear as an attachment in the Notes and Attachments related list on the Group's record.

Group Image URL-Hosts the link of the Group's Profile image displayed above the Group Name on the Community Group Detail page. The Group Owner can change the Group image from within the Community Portal by hovering over the image and clicking on the Change Photo button. Any changes to the Group image appear as an attachment in the Notes and Attachments related list on the Group's record.

Description-Appears on the banner image of the Community Group Detail page. If the created text is too long to fully appear in the provided area, users can click the Read More link to view a pop up window with group information.
